New Records: Dane Myers drove in a career-best 5 RBIs with a three-run home run and a bases-loaded double.
The Miami Marlins ended a 15-year series drought by defeating the Toronto Blue Jays 8-1.
Vladimir Guerrero Jr. was one hit shy of reaching 200 for the season.
Key Match Events: Dane Myers hit a three-run home run in the eighth inning.
Griffin Conine contributed with three hits and an RBI.
Xzavion Curry made his debut with a solid performance.
Miami's three-run sixth inning included a loaded double by Myers.
Pre-Game Insights: The Marlins were aiming to end a long losing streak against the Blue Jays.
Bench coach Luis Urueta managed due to the absence of Skip Schumaker.
Post-Match Reflections: Myers expressed relief at returning from injury and his performance.
Urueta highlighted Curry's strong debut and the team's win significance.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blue Jays struggled in September with a 7-16 record.
The Marlins' win streak reached three consecutive games.
